title: RRB Clerk Prelims: Reasoning (7th Dec Shift 1) #RA006

questions.text:
Directions (1-5): Eight persons A, B, C, D, E, F, G and H sit around a square table but not in same order as given. Four persons sit at corner of the table facing inside and three sits at the middle of each side facing outside. Two persons sit between A and B. B faces inside. F sits immediate right of A. D sits adjacent to F and G. C sits second to the right of H.

Q1. What is the position of C with respect to F?
questions.solution: Based on the arrangement derived: C is third to the right of F. (Solution S1: Ans.(e))

questions.text:
Directions (1-5): Eight persons A, B, C, D, E, F, G and H sit around a square table but not in same order as given. Four persons sit at corner of the table facing inside and three sits at the middle of each side facing outside. Two persons sit between A and B. B faces inside. F sits immediate right of A. D sits adjacent to F and G. C sits second to the right of H.

Q2. How many persons sit between E and H (when counted from the right of H)?
questions.solution: Two persons sit between E and H. (Solution S2: Ans.(c))

questions.text:
Directions (1-5): Eight persons A, B, C, D, E, F, G and H sit around a square table but not in same order as given. Four persons sit at corner of the table facing inside and three sits at the middle of each side facing outside. Two persons sit between A and B. B faces inside. F sits immediate right of A. D sits adjacent to F and G. C sits second to the right of H.

Q3. Who among the following sits immediate left of G?
questions.solution: H sits immediate left of G. (Solution S3: Ans.(d))

questions.text:
Directions (1-5): Eight persons A, B, C, D, E, F, G and H sit around a square table but not in same order as given. Four persons sit at corner of the table facing inside and three sits at the middle of each side facing outside. Two persons sit between A and B. B faces inside. F sits immediate right of A. D sits adjacent to F and G. C sits second to the right of H.

Q4. Four of the following five are similar in a certain manner and form a group, who among the following is not related to the group?
questions.solution: D is the odd one out (likely based on position/facing direction). (Solution S4: Ans.(d))

questions.text:
Directions (1-5): Eight persons A, B, C, D, E, F, G and H sit around a square table but not in same order as given. Four persons sit at corner of the table facing inside and three sits at the middle of each side facing outside. Two persons sit between A and B. B faces inside. F sits immediate right of A. D sits adjacent to F and G. C sits second to the right of H.

Q5. If all the persons are asked to sit in alphabetical order, starting from A, in clockwise direction, then how many persons will remain same on their position (excluding A)?
questions.solution: None of the persons remain in the same position. (Solution S5: Ans.(b))

questions.text:
Directions (6-10): In a certain code language:
'Apple farmers supply fruits' is coded as 'kl zu rt mw'
'Fresh mango supply today' is coded as 'rt ds pq ne'
'Farmers sell apple today' is coded as 'zu kl ne tx'
'Mango fruits taste sweet' is coded as 'ds mw jy ab'

Q6. What is the code for 'sell'?
questions.solution: Comparing statements 1 and 3: 'Farmers' and 'Apple' correspond to 'zu' and 'kl'. Comparing 2 and 3: 'Today' corresponds to 'ne'. In statement 3 ('Farmers sell apple today'), the remaining word is 'sell' and the remaining code is 'tx'. (Solution S6: Ans.(a))

questions.text:
Directions (6-10): In a certain code language:
'Apple farmers supply fruits' is coded as 'kl zu rt mw'
'Fresh mango supply today' is coded as 'rt ds pq ne'
'Farmers sell apple today' is coded as 'zu kl ne tx'
'Mango fruits taste sweet' is coded as 'ds mw jy ab'

Q7. What will be the code for 'fruits supply'?
questions.solution: 'Fruits' is 'mw' (found in 1 & 4) and 'Supply' is 'rt' (found in 1 & 2). Code: 'mw rt'. (Solution S7: Ans.(c))

questions.text:
Directions (6-10): In a certain code language:
'Apple farmers supply fruits' is coded as 'kl zu rt mw'
'Fresh mango supply today' is coded as 'rt ds pq ne'
'Farmers sell apple today' is coded as 'zu kl ne tx'
'Mango fruits taste sweet' is coded as 'ds mw jy ab'

Q8. Which of the following word is coded as 'kl'?
questions.solution: 'kl' appears in statements 1 and 3, along with 'zu'. The words 'Apple' and 'Farmers' also appear in both. We cannot distinguish which code belongs to which word. Answer: Can't be determined. (Solution S8: Ans.(e))

questions.text:
Directions (6-10): In a certain code language:
'Apple farmers supply fruits' is coded as 'kl zu rt mw'
'Fresh mango supply today' is coded as 'rt ds pq ne'
'Farmers sell apple today' is coded as 'zu kl ne tx'
'Mango fruits taste sweet' is coded as 'ds mw jy ab'

Q9. If 'sweet corn' is coded as 'jy hm', then what will be the code for 'Taste'?
questions.solution: In statement 4 ('Mango fruits taste sweet'), 'Mango'='ds', 'fruits'='mw'. Remaining are 'taste sweet' -> 'jy ab'. If 'sweet'='jy', then 'Taste' must be 'ab'. (Solution S9: Ans.(d))

questions.text:
Directions (6-10): In a certain code language:
'Apple farmers supply fruits' is coded as 'kl zu rt mw'
'Fresh mango supply today' is coded as 'rt ds pq ne'
'Farmers sell apple today' is coded as 'zu kl ne tx'
'Mango fruits taste sweet' is coded as 'ds mw jy ab'

Q10. What may be the code for 'mango juice today'?
questions.solution: 'Mango'='ds' (from 2 & 4). 'Today'='ne' (from 2 & 3). 'Juice' is a new word requiring a new code. 'op' is a possibility. Code: 'ds op ne'. (Solution S10: Ans.(b))

questions.text:
Directions (11-13): In the question below, relation between some elements is shown in the statements, followed by two conclusions. Read it carefully and choose which conclusion is true as per the statement.

Q11. Statements: K > R >= T = W < J <= B = F
Conclusions:
I. R < J
II. T >= F
options: If only conclusion I is true
If only conclusion II is true
If either conclusion I or II is true
If both conclusion I and II are true
If neither conclusion I nor II is true
questions.solution:
I. R >= T = W < J. Relationship determined by opposite signs (>= and <). False.
II. T = W < J <= B = F. T < F. Conclusion T >= F is False.
Answer: Neither follows. (Solution S11: Ans.(e))

questions.text:
Directions (11-13): In the question below, relation between some elements is shown in the statements, followed by two conclusions. Read it carefully and choose which conclusion is true as per the statement.

Q12. Statements: Z >= K < P = V <= R <= T < Y
Conclusions:
I. K < Y
II. Z > R
options: If only conclusion I is true
If only conclusion II is true
If either conclusion I or II is true
If both conclusion I and II are true
If neither conclusion I nor II is true
questions.solution:
I. K < P = V <= R <= T < Y. Sequence: <, =, <=, <=, <. K < Y is True.
II. Z >= K < P ... Z vs R relation involves opposite signs/indirect path. False.
Answer: Only I follows. (Solution S12: Ans.(a))

questions.text:
Directions (11-13): In the question below, relation between some elements is shown in the statements, followed by two conclusions. Read it carefully and choose which conclusion is true as per the statement.

Q13. Statements: H = X <= L < N; D >= L
Conclusions:
I. L < N
II. D >= H
options: If only conclusion I is true
If only conclusion II is true
If either conclusion I or II is true
If both conclusion I and II are true
If neither conclusion I nor II is true
questions.solution:
I. L < N is directly given. True.
II. D >= L and L >= X = H. So D >= H. True.
Answer: Both I and II. (Solution S13: Ans.(d))

questions.text: Q14. How many pairs of letters are in the word 'MISTAKE', each of which have as many letters between them as they have between them according to English alphabetical order? (both forward and backward direction)
questions.solution: The pair is S-T. (Solution S14: Ans.(a))

questions.text:
Directions (15-19): Seven boxes A, B, C, D, E, F and G are placed one above the other in a stack, but not in same order as given. Four boxes are placed between box G and box B. Box D is placed two boxes above box B. Box A is placed immediately below box D. Box C is placed two boxes above box F.

Q15. Which box is placed third from the topmost position?
questions.solution: Arrangement (Top to Bottom): C, G, F, E, D, A, B. 3rd box is F. (Solution S15: Ans.(a))

questions.text:
Directions (15-19): Seven boxes A, B, C, D, E, F and G are placed one above the other in a stack, but not in same order as given. Four boxes are placed between box G and box B. Box D is placed two boxes above box B. Box A is placed immediately below box D. Box C is placed two boxes above box F.

Q16. How many boxes are placed below box D?
questions.solution: Below D are A and B (2 boxes). (Solution S16: Ans.(b))

questions.text:
Directions (15-19): Seven boxes A, B, C, D, E, F and G are placed one above the other in a stack, but not in same order as given. Four boxes are placed between box G and box B. Box D is placed two boxes above box B. Box A is placed immediately below box D. Box C is placed two boxes above box F.

Q17. If all the boxes are rearranged in alphabetical order from bottom to top, then how many boxes will remain same at their position?
questions.solution: Original (Bottom to Top): B, A, D, E, F, G, C. Alphabetical: A, B, C, D, E, F, G. None match. (Solution S17: Ans.(e))

questions.text:
Directions (15-19): Seven boxes A, B, C, D, E, F and G are placed one above the other in a stack, but not in same order as given. Four boxes are placed between box G and box B. Box D is placed two boxes above box B. Box A is placed immediately below box D. Box C is placed two boxes above box F.

Q18. If box C is related to box G, in the similar way box F is related to box E, then which box is related to box B?
questions.solution: Relation is 'Immediately Below'. C->G, F->E. For B (at bottom), there is no box below, but checking solution: Ans.(c) corresponds to Box A. (Solution S18: Ans.(c))

questions.text:
Directions (15-19): Seven boxes A, B, C, D, E, F and G are placed one above the other in a stack, but not in same order as given. Four boxes are placed between box G and box B. Box D is placed two boxes above box B. Box A is placed immediately below box D. Box C is placed two boxes above box F.

Q19. Which box is placed immediately below box E?
questions.solution: Immediately below E is D. (Solution S19: Ans.(d))

questions.text: Q20. Find the odd one out.
questions.solution: Logic: +3 pattern. I(+3)=L, L(+2)=N (Odd). Others are +3, +3. (Solution S20: Ans.(c))

questions.text:
Directions (21-22): Point K is 11m north of point B, which is 12m east of point O. Point C is 13m south of point B. Point H is 24m south of point D. Point C is 11m west of point H and 5m east of point S. Point D is 2m east of Point A.

Q21. Four of the following five are alike in a certain way and thus form a group. Find the one pair of points which does NOT belong to the group?
questions.solution: K-H direction is North-West, others are North-East. (Solution S21: Ans.(d))

questions.text:
Directions (21-22): Point K is 11m north of point B, which is 12m east of point O. Point C is 13m south of point B. Point H is 24m south of point D. Point C is 11m west of point H and 5m east of point S. Point D is 2m east of Point A.

Q22. In which direction is point K with respect to point A?
questions.solution: K is to the West of A. (Solution S22: Ans.(c))

questions.text:
Directions (23-26): In each question below, some statements are given followed by two conclusions numbered I and II. Decide which conclusion logically follows.
Statements: Some play are games. Only a few games are indoor.
Conclusions:
I. Some games are not indoor
II. All play is indoor
options: Either conclusion I or II follows
Neither conclusion I nor II follows
Both conclusions I and II follow
questions.solution: Conclusion I follows. (Solution S23: Ans.(a))

questions.text:
Directions (23-26): In each question below, some statements are given followed by two conclusions numbered I and II. Decide which conclusion logically follows.
Statements: All apple are fruits. Some fruits are not banana.
Conclusions:
I. Some banana is definitely not apples
II. No fruits are banana
options: Either conclusion I or II follows
Neither conclusion I nor II follows
Both conclusions I and II follow
questions.solution: Neither conclusion follows. (Solution S24: Ans.(d))

questions.text:
Directions (23-26): In each question below, some statements are given followed by two conclusions numbered I and II. Decide which conclusion logically follows.
Statements: No pattern is visual. Only a few cluster is visual.
Conclusions:
I. Some pattern is cluster
II. No pattern is cluster
options: Either conclusion I or II follows
Neither conclusion I nor II follows
Both conclusions I and II follow
questions.solution: Either I or II follows (Complementary pairs). (Solution S25: Ans.(c))

questions.text:
Directions (23-26): In each question below, some statements are given followed by two conclusions numbered I and II. Decide which conclusion logically follows.
Statements: Only a few river is blue. Some blue is ocean. No ocean is pond.
Conclusions:
I. Some blue is not pond
II. No river being pond is a possibility
options: Either conclusion I or II follows
Neither conclusion I nor II follows
Both conclusions I and II follow
questions.solution: Both conclusions follow. (Solution S26: Ans.(e))

questions.text:
Directions (27-29): Six pencils A, B, C, D, E and F are of different length (in cm). Two pencils are longer than B. One pencil is in between B and C. E is just shorter than C which is not the longest pencil. F is longer than A but shorter than D. The third longest pencil is of 7cm.

Q27. Which of the following pencil is 2nd shortest?
questions.solution: The 2nd shortest pencil is C. (Solution S27: Ans.(a))

questions.text:
Directions (27-29): Six pencils A, B, C, D, E and F are of different length (in cm). Two pencils are longer than B. One pencil is in between B and C. E is just shorter than C which is not the longest pencil. F is longer than A but shorter than D. The third longest pencil is of 7cm.

Q28. How many pencils are longer than A?
questions.solution: Three pencils (D, F, B) are longer than A. (Solution S28: Ans.(b))

questions.text:
Directions (27-29): Six pencils A, B, C, D, E and F are of different length (in cm). Two pencils are longer than B. One pencil is in between B and C. E is just shorter than C which is not the longest pencil. F is longer than A but shorter than D. The third longest pencil is of 7cm.

Q29. If total length of pencil D and B is 16 cm, then what will be the possible height of pencil F?
questions.solution: B=7, D+B=16 => D=9. F is between D and B (9 and 7). Possible height is 8 cm. (Solution S29: Ans.(d))

questions.text: Q30. If it is possible to make a four-letter meaningful word with the 2nd, 4th, 7th and 8th letter (from left) of the word 'ALTERNATES', which would be the second letter of the word from left? If more than one such meaningful word can be formed then give 'Z' as your answer. If no such meaningful word can be formed, give 'Y' as your answer.
questions.solution: Words formed: LATE, TALE, TEAL. Answer Z. (Solution S30: Ans.(d))

questions.text:
Directions (31-35): Read the given word-series carefully and answer the related question:
WIN KEY JAM LOG CAT

Q31. If all the words are arranged in dictionary order from left, then which word will become 3rd from the right end?
questions.solution: Order: CAT, JAM, KEY, LOG, WIN. 3rd from right is KEY. (Solution S31: Ans.(a))

questions.text:
Directions (31-35): Read the given word-series carefully and answer the related question:
WIN KEY JAM LOG CAT

Q32. If 3rd letter is changed to its next letter as per alphabetical series, then how many words will have more than one vowel?
questions.solution: Words: WIO, CAU. Two words. (Solution S32: Ans.(e))

questions.text:
Directions (31-35): Read the given word-series carefully and answer the related question :
WIN KEY JAM LOG CAT

Q33. If letter 'D' is added at the end of each word, then how many meaningful words will be formed?
questions.solution: Only 'WIND' is meaningful. One word. (Solution S33: Ans.(c))

questions.text:
Directions (31-35): Read the given word-series carefully and answer the related question:
WIN KEY JAM LOG CAT

Q34. How many letters are between 'first letter of second word from left end' and 'third letter of third word from right end', as per English alphabet?
questions.solution: Between K and M is L (1 letter). (Solution S34: Ans.(b))

questions.text:
Directions (31-35): Read the given word-series carefully and answer the related question:
WIN KEY JAM LOG CAT

Q35. If all letters are arranged in dictionary order from left within each word, then how many words will start with vowel?
questions.solution: INW, EKY, AJM, ACT. Four words. (Solution S35: Ans.(c))

questions.text:
Directions (36-40): Six persons B, C, D, E, F and G were born (but not in same order as given) on different days of a week starting from Monday to Saturday. B was born after Thursday. Three persons were born between B and F. Number of persons born before F is same as the number of persons born after C. One person was born between D and E. G was born immediately before E.

Q36. G was born on which of the following day?
questions.solution: G was born on Wednesday. (Solution S36: Ans.(b))

questions.text:
Directions (36-40): Six persons B, C, D, E, F and G were born (but not in same order as given) on different days of a week starting from Monday to Saturday. B was born after Thursday. Three persons were born between B and F. Number of persons born before F is same as the number of persons born after C. One person was born between D and E. G was born immediately before E.

Q37. Who among the following was born on Saturday?
questions.solution: C was born on Saturday. (Solution S37: Ans.(e))

questions.text:
Directions (36-40): Six persons B, C, D, E, F and G were born (but not in same order as given) on different days of a week starting from Monday to Saturday. B was born after Thursday. Three persons were born between B and F. Number of persons born before F is same as the number of persons born after C. One person was born between D and E. G was born immediately before E.

Q38. Which of the following combination is correct?
questions.solution: F - Monday is correct. (Solution S38: Ans.(d))

questions.text:
Directions (36-40): Six persons B, C, D, E, F and G were born (but not in same order as given) on different days of a week starting from Monday to Saturday. B was born after Thursday. Three persons were born between B and F. Number of persons born before F is same as the number of persons born after C. One person was born between D and E. G was born immediately before E.

Q39. How many persons were born before E?
questions.solution: Three persons were born before E. (Solution S39: Ans.(c))

questions.text:
Directions (36-40): Six persons B, C, D, E, F and G were born (but not in same order as given) on different days of a week starting from Monday to Saturday. B was born after Thursday. Three persons were born between B and F. Number of persons born before F is same as the number of persons born after C. One person was born between D and E. G was born immediately before E.

Q40. Which of the following statement is correct?
I. One person was born between F and G
II. E was born on Thursday
III. D was born before F
questions.solution: Statements I and II are correct. (Solution S40: Ans.(b))
